meanings.sent1: She bawls when she is upset.
meanings.sent2: The baby bawls when he is hungry.
meanings.sent3: During the sad movie, the audience bawls along with the characters.
meanings.sent4: The wind bawls through the trees on stormy nights.
meanings.sent5: His heart bawls with sorrow at the thought of leaving.

meanings.definition: The act of crying loudly and unrestrainedly.
meanings.sent1: His bawls echoed through the empty house.
meanings.sent2: The child's bawls could be heard from the next room.
meanings.sent3: The bawls of the baby woke up the entire household.
meanings.sent4: The bawls of the wounded animal pierced the silence of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The bawls of joy filled the room as they celebrated their victory.

meanings.definition: A loud, unrestrained cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: The bawls of the protesters could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: Her bawls of frustration filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The bawls of the fans filled the stadium with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The bawls of the thunder shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The bawls of the coach motivated the team to push harder.
